Projects

Lecthur - Visual micro-learning mobile app

  • Swift
  • Kotlin
  • Firebase
Lecthur is a visual micro-learning platform designed to make lifelong learning engaging and accessible for Spanish-speaking audiences. I developed Lecthur to deliver daily bite-sized lessons—under 5 minutes—on topics such as science, politics, and economics. The platform includes interactive quizzes to reinforce knowledge retention and promote active learning.
Preview

Spendo - AI Expense Tracker

  • Swift
  • OpenAI API
Spendo is a conversational finance app that empowers users to manage their money through daily interactions with an AI assistant. I built Spendo to help users track expenses, monitor budgets, and stay motivated with gamified savings challenges. The app combines real-time financial data with personalized AI-driven insights to encourage better money habits.
Preview

About me

Hi, I’m Angello Nunez — a passionate software engineering student at Western Governors University with a love for building innovative web and mobile applications. I have been living in the USA for more than 5 years. I thrive at the intersection of creativity and technology, constantly exploring new ways to bring ideas to life through code.

As a content creator, I run a YouTube channel where I simplify complex tech topics through visual, easy-to-understand explanations — making learning accessible to everyone. I’m also an entrepreneur at heart, having founded two companies: Zelandaware, focused on software solutions, and Emprezus, a Spanish-language educational platform for entrepreneurs.

Whether it’s designing intuitive apps, solving real-world problems with technology, or taking on new challenges, I’m driven by curiosity and a desire to make a meaningful impact through software.
